meanings.definition: The quality of being acceptable or suitable for a bank to provide financial support or backing.
meanings.sent1: The bankability of the project made it easy to secure a loan.
meanings.sent2: Her business plan's bankability impressed the loan officer.
meanings.sent3: The bankability of his idea was so strong, even the piggy bank wanted in!
meanings.sent4: The bankability of the proposal shone like a golden coin in a sea of pennies.
meanings.sent5: The bankability of the investment was as clear as a dollar bill in a wallet.

meanings.definition: The likelihood of a project or investment being able to secure funding from a bank.
meanings.sent1: The high bankability of the venture attracted many investors.
meanings.sent2: The bankability of the idea made it a safe bet for funding.
meanings.sent3: With such strong bankability, the project practically had a money magnet!
meanings.sent4: The bankability of the plan was like a beacon guiding financial support.
meanings.sent5: The bankability of the proposal sparkled like a diamond in the rough.
